variables.bug_title: Memory Leak in Student Performance Analytics Dashboard
variables.bug_description: The Student Performance Analytics Dashboard exhibits a memory leak when displaying large datasets (>1000 students). Memory usage continuously increases over time and eventually causes browser crashes or severe performance degradation.
variables.step_2: Load a large dataset with 1000+ students and multiple semesters
variables.step_3: Interact with filters and charts for 10-15 minutes
variables.expected_behavior: Memory usage should remain stable after initial data load. Chart interactions should not cause memory accumulation. Browser should maintain responsive performance throughout the session.
variables.actual_behavior: Memory usage continuously increases with each chart interaction. After 10-15 minutes, browser becomes unresponsive. Dev tools show memory usage growing from ~50MB to >500MB.
variables.screenshots: Browser dev tools memory profiler showing continuous memory growth. Performance timeline showing degradation over time.
variables.additional_info: The issue appears to be related to chart library event listeners not being properly cleaned up and possibly duplicate data subscriptions. Memory leak is most noticeable with Chart.js visualizations.
